sub_title: Ecosystems & Biodiversity Manager at Olam Food Ingredients. PhD Sustainability researcher at the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. EU H2020 Marie-Curie fellow of the COUPLED project (coupled-itn.eu).
summary:
With 10 years of experience in the sustainability sector, I lead analytics and leverage research insights to design and implement sustainability action in the fields of land use change, deforestation and climate risk. I currently focus on the cocoa sector but I use tools and methods applicable to tropical agricultural commodities. My focus is on the impacts of agriculture across scales, from the farm to the global systems as a consequence of the globalized and telecoupled nature of agricultural supply chains.  

As sustainability researcher I’ve studied the impacts of global agricultural commodities on deforestation, biodiversity loss, carbon stocks, and livelihoods using a large combination of quantitative methods such as LCA, land use modeling, spatial analysis, statistical modeling, trade flow analysis. Currently focused on the global global cocoa value chain.

I have experience in political advocacy on issues related to climate change, sustainable agriculture, sustainable land management, and nature conservation in tropical areas. Experience working with multiple sectors, especially national governments, multilateral and bilateral cooperation. 

My interest is on the the private sector setting up the powerful strategies to lead the sustainability pathway across society. Strong focus on agri-commodity business, banking and investment sectors.

I’m also part of the global team using this information to define and implement action plans and projects aimed to achieve sustainable sourcing.

profile_positions.description:
Fellow of the EU H2020 project "COUPLED: Operationalising Telecouplings for Solving Sustainability Challenges for Land Use"
Research on the cross-scale impacts of global value chains of agricultural commodities. 
Conducting research on the environmental impact assessment tools used by the corporate sector for sustainability governance of global agricultural commodities. Studying the case of cocoa production in West Africa and the sustainability implications of the global cocoa value chain.

Research on the global cocoa supply chain and cross-scale impacts between farm level practices and landscape impacts. Focus on global supply chain research, land use modelling, life cycle assessment, deforestation, carbon and biodiversity accounting.
